channel.title: [Suggestion]Moparscape TOS Timer
channel.description: I suggest you put a timer on the TOS so it will take them that much time until they can click the OK, or w/e button. I really want a type of script that actually makes the read it, or you have to read it to enter.

item.title: [Suggestion]Moparscape TOS Timer
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

How about my idea i ahd for my forums, in the TOS include a few bold and italic and underlined chars, and sum were near the end, in completely normal text put the sentance “Now if you agree and want to enter type all the italic letters in the box below”, not at the very end, like a sentence or two from it…

Read full topic

item.title: [Suggestion]Moparscape TOS Timer
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“nator123123, post:1, topic:96143”]I suggest you put a timer on the TOS so it will take them that much time until they can click the OK, or w/e button.
I really want a type of script that actually makes the read it, or you have to read it to enter.[/quote]
You didn’t read it. You know how I know? You try to enforce it like an Administrator/Moderator. People that have actually read the TOS, don’t care about posting about it, unless of course they’re in a staff position. When I first came to moparisthebest, I didn’t read it. I just… entered yes, as you do. And I was trying to enforce and be a little goody two shoes like you “nator123123”. I actually read it, and now I don’t care about it. If a noob does something wrong, why bother tell him to read the TOS? All he’s going to do is just simply keep on ignoring it.

Sorry, that post went waaayyyy off-topic.
I too would like a script to make people read the TOS. But, sadly, it will never happen. They will just wait. Like a Do you accept the Terms of etc. Who actually reads them? About as many people who read the TOS. on their first visit.

Read full topic

item.title: [Suggestion]Moparscape TOS Timer
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

[quote=“FastBawlz, post:8, topic:96143”][quote author=The Un-Named link=topic=138755.msg1337292#msg1337292 date=1179545015]
I got an idea, have a “hidden” message.
[/quote]

Like on a random rule say

“Instead of saying yes , say Pikachu?”[/quote]

I actually was on a forum that had that same method on its TOS. I was too lazy to read through the hundred rules, so I just checked the source at the part around the ‘submit’ button, and I found the secret code

Read full topic

item.title: [Suggestion]Moparscape TOS Timer
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

[quote=“nator123123, post:17, topic:96143”][quote author=The Un-Named link=topic=138755.msg1337292#msg1337292 date=1179545015]
I got an idea, have a “hidden” message.
[/quote]
I’ve thought of that, but nubs who don’t read the rules leave.
Edit: I really wasn’t into the timer, just something that makes them read the rules.[/quote]
good if they’re too ignorant to read the rules than they can leave

Read full topic

item.title: [Suggestion]Moparscape TOS Timer
item.dc:creator: @nator123123 nator123123
item.description:
@nator123123 wrote:

Maybe instead of a message, there is a message inside the rules on what to click or w/e, such as click on every rule number etc. etc.
I have heard of a dialog box, something you can’t exit of.
I think it’s in HTML form.

Read full topic

item.title: [Suggestion]Moparscape TOS Timer
item.dc:creator: @Uriko Uriko
item.description:
@Uriko wrote:

[quote=“FastBawlz, post:8, topic:96143”][quote author=The Un-Named link=topic=138755.msg1337292#msg1337292 date=1179545015]
I got an idea, have a “hidden” message.
[/quote]

Like on a random rule say

“Instead of saying yes , say Pikachu?”[/quote]Would contradict what it would say at the ending then. + That’s pretty assholish, I wouldn’t expect someone to read it if I wrote out a TOS.

Edit: For the record, I’ve read the rules, just not the TOS.

Read full topic

item.title: [Suggestion]Moparscape TOS Timer
item.dc:creator: @nator123123 nator123123
item.description:
@nator123123 wrote:

The Un-Named:

I got an idea, have a “hidden” message.

I’ve thought of that, but nubs who don’t read the rules leave.
Edit: I really wasn’t into the timer, just something that makes them read the rules.

item.title: [Suggestion]Moparscape TOS Timer
item.dc:creator: @deoxys505 deoxys505
item.description:
@deoxys505 wrote:

[quote=“Mod Taharok, post:15, topic:96143”][quote author=io9 link=topic=136582.msg1338515#msg1338515 date=1179560389]
Maybe we should change the quiz so that it asks questions about the agreement, and not allow the user to view the agreement more than once.
[/quote]

I agree with io9. Along with The Un-Named’s random message idea I think it would actually make them read it. And, maybe Mopar can make a couple random messages and a single one is randomly chosen so that their friends don’t tell them.[/quote]lol yeah, and at the end where it now says “type ‘yes’ if you agree to these terms” or whatever, it should just be blank and you have to type the answer to the hidden message.

Read full topic

item.title: [Suggestion]Moparscape TOS Timer
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[Suggestion] Anti-Noob Protection System

Maybe we should change the quiz so that it asks questions about the agreement, and not allow the user to view the agreement more than once.

I agree with io9. Along with The Un-Named’s random message idea I think it would actually make them read it. And, maybe Mopar can make a couple random messages and a single one is randomly chosen so that their friends don’t tell them.

Read full topic

item.title: [Suggestion]Moparscape TOS Timer
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

[quote=“lothy, post:13, topic:96143”]I like The Un-Named’s idea better - far more feasible. There are flaws with timers: who says they’ll actually read while waiting for the timer to expire?
At least with The Un-Named’s you know they’ve read most of the page (to find the hidden message).[/quote]
Yes, 'tis a good idea.

Also, with the timer, if you had already read it before you would again have to wait until granted access.
tbh, Very annoying.

Read full topic

item.title: [Suggestion]Moparscape TOS Timer
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

I like The Un-Named’s idea better - far more feasible. There are flaws with timers: who says they’ll actually read while waiting for the timer to expire?
At least with The Un-Named’s you know they’ve read most of the page (to find the hidden message).

Read full topic
